reviewText:
+ Fun local multiplayer humour like similar card games.
+ This game is terrible enough to be a gag in itself.
+ Could probably run on a potato.

- The movement of the characters is jerky and continuous and really gets on your nerves after a while.
- The music gets on your nerves before the jerky movement of the characters does.
- The voice acting is terrible and more akin to the Hungarian-English Dictionary sketch than the Dead Parrot sketch.
- No pause menu.
- No graphics settings menu.
- ESC exits the game without a prompt.
- Local multiplayer with an unforgiving timer, causing issues with passing on the mouse.

tl;dr; 3/10

With regards to my playtime; I kept the game running only as long as it needed for me to write a review. I was bored out of my mind within the first two minutes.

Oh...Sir! Is a hiarious turn based linguistic puzzle game of sorts. The storyline is like something straight out of a Montey Python bit, whereas a constumer has returned to the show from which he has purchased an ex-parrot, it is no more, it has ceased to be. Players take turns exchanging insults piece by piece. A turn is completed when a player has selected a short phrase from a joint word bank or a personal work bank or when their time has run out. A round ends when both players are ready to insult eachother or when there are no more phrases left to be had. The game ends when one of the two player's HP bars reaches zero. The game is actually rather fast paced with limited time to read options and decide on the best course of action before time expires on your turn. For a game completed in 42 hours it's actually pretty awesome. I would have liked a handful of more phrase options through which to cycle for subsiquent rounds of play, but again, 42 hours. The voiceovers in the game are okay, nothing spectacular, but the worst is the bla bla... sound effect. Overall, decent game in short doses, very funny, well worth the download since it's free to play.

Oh...Sir! Is a hiarious turn based linguistic puzzle game of sorts. The storyline is like something straight out of a Montey Python bit, whereas a constumer has returned to the show from which he has purchased an ex-parrot, it is no more, it has ceased to be. Players take turns exchanging insults piece by piece. A turn is completed when a player has selected a short phrase from a joint word bank or a personal work bank or when their time has run out. A round ends when both players are ready to insult eachother or when there are no more phrases left to be had. The game ends when one of the two player's HP bars reaches zero. The game is actually rather fast paced with limited time to read options and decide on the best course of action before time expires on your turn. For a game completed in 42 hours it's actually pretty awesome. I would have liked a handful of more phrase options through which to cycle for subsiquent rounds of play, but again, 42 hours. The voiceovers in the game are okay, nothing spectacular, but the worst is the bla bla... sound effect. Overall, decent game in short doses, very funny, well worth the download since it's free to play.
